intro: Reseda bungei var. scabrida, commonly known as rough reseda, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in rough, scabrous hairs. The leaves are linear to lanceolate, with a hairy surface and often a reddish or purplish tinge. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, blooming from late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to dry conditions, with deep roots and a capacity to store water in its tissues.
